long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Li Scraper can copy public information from LinkedIn Recruiter User Profile and paste it into your google sheet in one click. 

Public information means: 
1. Full name
2. Title of lead
3. Company name
4. Number of connections
5. Link on linkedin profile
6. Location
7. Type of Industry

To do it user should:
 - create project - fill all input in the form.

   Form:
   1. Name of Project should be unic.
   2. Sheet link - it's link of your Google Sheet.
   3. Sheet Name - it's name of tab of your Google Sheet.
   4. Data you need to scrape. You should to choose column name of Google Sheet 
       where you want to paste your data.
   5. Click the button "Create Project".
   *To find this info just look at the screenshots.



 - share google sheet with extention as a Editor.

This is needed for the extention to be able to enter information on google sheet. Email link is in the top of options page.
Email: 'addon-223@learned-sprite-332518.iam.gserviceaccount.com'



 - choose current project

Just click on the project you want.



 -  Do scrapping

Move to the Linkedin Navigator profile you want to scrape and click on the button "Scrape" on the left top corner. After that you will see alert on the left bottom corner of you browser. If alert is green - everything is OK, but if alert is red - something gone wrong.



- If you want to scrape such data like a Company Location and Industry you should before click on the button "Scrape" move you cursore on the company name near current title name (position in company) of user profile. You wiil see mini window with company info. Thats all you need. After that just click on the button "Scrape".


All information that you copy send to our server. Server for its part sends this information to your Google Sheet through Google Sheet API.
